snippet: More than 1.5 million Haitians are threatened with malnutrition — double the number of six months ago — because of a three-year-old drought.
abstract: United Nations anti-hunger agency, World Food Program, classifies 1.5 million Haitians as 'severely food insecure' and says they are threatened with malnutrition; also reports up to 70 percent of crops has been lost because of three-year drought made worse by El Nino.
lead_paragraph: More than 1.5 million Haitians are threatened with malnutrition — double the number of six months ago — because of a three-year-old drought.

headline.main: Haiti: Drought Worsens Food Crisis, U.N. Agency Says
headline.print_headline: The Americans; Haiti: Drought Worsens Food Crisis, U.N. Agency Says
